Package database

Class DBAppointments

java.lang.Object
database.DBAppointments
public abstract class DBAppointments extends Object
This abstract class is for manipulating the Appointment records in the database and not meant to be instantiated. The class contains methods to insert, update, delete and return all Appointment records as an ObservableList of Appointment objects.

      An ObservableList of Appointment objects.

    • insertAppointment

      public static void insertAppointment(String title, String type, Timestamp start, Timestamp end, int customerId, int salespersonId, int stateId, int regionId) throws SQLException
      This method is used to insert a new Appointment record into the database.
      Parameters:
      title - as a string.
      type - as a string
      start - as a TimeStamp object
      end - as a TimeStamp object.
      customerId - as an int.
      salespersonId - as an int.
      stateId - as an int.
      regionId - as an int.
      Throws:
      SQLException - Throws a SQLException if the SQL does not execute properly.

      This method is used to update an existing Appointment record into the database.
      Parameters:

      start - as a TimeStamp object
      end - as a TimeStamp object.
      customerId - as an int.

    • deleteAppointment

      public static void deleteAppointment(int appointmentId) throws SQLException
      This method is used to delete existing Appointment record into the database by entering the appointmentId.
      Parameters:
      appointmentId - as an int.
      Throws:
      SQLException - Throws a SQLException if the SQL does not execute properly.

    • deleteAppointmentsByClient

      public static void deleteAppointmentsByClient(int clientId) throws SQLException
      This method is used to delete existing Appointment records from the database based on clientId. The method is used when a client record is being deleted and all associated appointments need to be deleted to maintain database integrity.
      Parameters:
      clientId - as an int.
      Throws:
      SQLException - Throws a SQLException if the SQL does not execute properly.
